content.label: I finished the game recently and the story is so amazing. The graphics are great also. The controls are quick and easy to learn and work great on my iPhone. There is one thing that I think would be cool to add to the game. I think that there should be different weather changes and there should be a night time and day time (like Legends of Zelda: Breath of the Wild). Also, I would really like to see a prequel to this game where you are Master Mayfair in the Direfolk Wars. Or at least a character who fought in that war. That would be a really fun game explaining what happened before in more detail. Overall, I rate this game 5 stars and would totally recommend it to a friend.
You guys fixed the issues! Hooray! It is now 5 STARS WORTHY in my opinion!

This game is clearly far too big for the developer making it. The content is not well designed, the game runs poorly, and while it looks pretty on the surface, if you look even a bit closely you‚Äôll see how unpolished it is. Do yourselves a favor and if you‚Äôre interested in or enjoy this game, play a Zelda game. Doesn‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs a lesser game in the franchise, it‚Äôs still leaps and bounds better than this. (Phillips CDI games don‚Äôt count, I see you.)

I‚Äôve been searching for an online mobile game that I could really get into, something similar to Fable 2, Skyrim, Or Oblivion. (Big fan of the rpgüòÄ) I had SERIOUS doubts that a decent game could be developed as an app, but, happily, I was mistaken. 
I‚Äôm not gonna go into detail too much, but this game checks off all the items on my wanted list! Storyline-graphics-playability....etc. The look is phenomenal, as well!! 
I just wanted to leave a little note to potential players, so they didn‚Äôt miss out on this game. Download it. You won‚Äôt be sorry.

This game is stunning for an RPG mobile game. The graphics and free play are amazing, and I feel like I‚Äôm on a console...mostly. I gave only 3 stars because as great as it is, I could be improved for more fluid game play. The touch screen controls are frustrating at times, directions in combat can be very challenging to control. I know that a Bluetooth gaming controller would probably improve that drastically, but this is a mobile game....in the App Store, for mobile devices. I‚Äôd prefer the quality of touch screen to be improved rather than relying/pushing for people to play with gaming controls. 

Also, Gen and Trin are very close to useless and get in the way so much. I understand they have to follow, but do they really need to get shoulder to shoulder....even during combat?? I have wasted so many bullets and bombs from them literally just walking right in the path of my shot. Not even to fight, just to stand next to me. They also do not consistently follow orders to attack and hit things. The only benefit I‚Äôve found so far is when I need three people to stand on triggers for puzzles. They don‚Äôt add anything to the game for me, and actually make it really frustrating to play. It would be great if they weren‚Äôt programmed to be so clumsy and slow. Or just to automatically attack the closest enemy to them. 

However, the game truly is incredible as far as how far the technology has come with graphics. It‚Äôs crazy we can play these types of games on our phones, so I look forward to the improvements in mobile gaming technology.

This game is so amazing and beautiful I couldn‚Äôt believe it was a mobile game. All of the characters are voice acted. That blue my mind. The world is smooth and the controls are smooth. The puzzles are fun and interesting and so is the story line. I want more of this game I was sad when I beat it.

A lot of this game is pretty enjoyable but the combat is just annoying. Enemies lack any real tells and kind of just bombard you with attacks. There is also just some issues I have with the way it controls, feels pretty rigid and I‚Äôm always hitting buttons when I meaning to just walk or aim. I think being able to calibrate/move UI a bit would help some of us fat thumbed folks haha. Otherwise the art is nice and the puzzles are pretty enjoyable.
The BEST game I‚Äôve ever played on my phone. I mean wow! Excellent! I can‚Äôt wait for the next one

So I‚Äôve made it to the giant turtle and I‚Äôve tried like 3 billion times I still can‚Äôt beat him I keep trying but he just keeps beating me whenever he shoots out the balls of fire or whatever it‚Äôs just overwhelming but overall it‚Äôs a great game I really love like that you can move around easily and like but sometimes I forget there‚Äôs no jump button can you add a jump button because likeThat would be helpfulI love this game so much I‚Äôm hooked it took me a while to get to the giant turtle but I‚Äôm there I just can‚Äôt beat Please consider the suggestion about the jump button have a nice day

title.label: If BoTW had a cousin this would be it

content.label:
Off the bat, this game is gorgeous in terms of cinematography. The direction of the cut-scenes isn‚Äôt something I‚Äôve seen of other Apple Arcade games, let alone phone games. The directing in and of itself is what compelled me to 4 stars instead of 3. The vibe to it is very Zelda-esqe in overall environment and game play, mixed with Shadow of the Colossus style boss fights.  
The controls are a bit janky, but my biggest complaint has to be auto-jump. There was so many times where being able to control my jumps would‚Äôve gotten me out of an easily avoidable jam but alas...auto-jump. I‚Äôd also recommend separating the interact with environment button from the attack button. The amount of times I went to smash a pot but picked it up instead is astronomical. There‚Äôs also a severe lack of facial expressions in every cutscene. Characters look bored but their voices tell a different story. 

Speaking of characters, every last one of them is white. Even the NPC‚Äôs just walking around are white. The fact that me, a white person, was so alarmed at how white every single person in this game was is really telling. Developers, it‚Äôs not hard to diversify, please don‚Äôt shy away from it. Having diverse characters and NPC‚Äôs would only add to immersion. You made bird people and fish people but drew a line at black and brown people? Like...really?

Now, onto the storyline *SPOILERS*
While it‚Äôs too late to make any story changes I feel this important to note. I found that I was never ‚Äúrooting for the home team‚Äù so to speak. There was no attempt at coaxing players into a false sense of security and trust. Once you arrive in white city you learn about the emblems and how the king just kinda..took and/or coerced them away from the civilizations that revered them. It left a bad impression. Akin to how Britain raided sacred items of other cultures to put them in a museum for their own gain. I never wanted to ‚Äúwin‚Äù, I never felt like a hero. I felt like a pawn being used to do someone else‚Äôs dirty work. Which I ultimately was, but had that fact been hidden from me until the climax of the story it would‚Äôve hit harder. But because it wasn‚Äôt kept secret I found myself dragging my feet and not wanting to progress the story because I knew I wasn‚Äôt helping anyone other than the king. There were times where I would‚Äôve preferred to be fighting WITH the bad guys. So much so that I hoped the game was leading up to a ‚Äúchoose your side‚Äù choice but it never came, and so I fought off the dark army with little excitement. 

Anyways. Idk how to end this review. The game is pretty, the music is nice especially any trumpet/clarinet parts, but the story left much to be desired. The end

I‚Äôve literally tried 2 times to defeat the squid boss and right in the middle of battle it stops letting me attack him but he can still attack me. Extremely frustrating. The game is glitchy.

I love the game but, their is no sound at all and there needs to be a jump button and sprint button that would be a hell alot better. It‚Äôs a lot like Zelda and I just love that, also the spears and swords need to last longer than 3 hits. Other than that it‚Äôs an amazing game. Apart form there being no sound!

title.label: Reason on its own for getting Apple Arcade

content.label: This game is what made me want to try Apple Arcade. When paired with a ps4 controller, it doesn‚Äôt feel at all like a mobile game but a console experience. It is fun, beautiful and the puzzles feel good to figure out. There‚Äôs no reason to not play this.
I like it

This game feels awesome! The graphics to the gameplay mechanics, on controller, to touch screen, it plays exceptionally well. This game feels  so advanced and if this is where gaming is headed, were in for a treat! It certainly isn‚Äôt perfect and I‚Äôll get to that later but the whole game as it‚Äôs self is just great!

A big issue I have with this game that can be an easy fix, is the layout. Being able to change and perfect a layout that suits you would be epic! I constantly find myself trying to shoot enemies and the aim and shoot button feels off, or trying to shield but missing. I known I‚Äôm probably not alone and this could be a huge improvement. Thank you for the good hours I‚Äôve soaked into this brilliant game, I wish I could do it all over. So much fun into a mobile game, this is really a new generation!
Great game, love quests and graphics

Hey guys my Oceanhorn 2 experience was awesome next gen graphics on mobile my only problem is overheating on my iPad Pro 2017 I‚Äôm sure more updates are coming also please add 60 FPS mode for iPad Pro 2017

After about 23 hours spent playing it it was sad to see the credits. Good adventure game that have huge levels. There are some places I missed so the game could take longer. I think the hardest big boss that I faced was that spikes creature that lives in the ice cavern. I did not care much about the story but I am never into that in games. I prefer to skip and keep playing.

üë®‚ÄçüíªREVIEWüë©‚Äçüíª

Great game, and a must have for all gamers. This is a great game we‚Äôre you can adventure the really nice and detailed map üó∫, whether you're into console, mobile, or computer games! Ocean horn 2 features all 3!

üìåTip for new and confused players that read this reviewüìå

If you think you are lost in this huge map, that‚Äôs ok! üëåI‚Äôve been wandering around the same places for hours before exploring the map and making this an even more EPIC adventure.
Note üìù: If you are unsure what to do or how to do something, exploring the map helps greatly. I‚Äôve also been confused many times and then found the solution just by exploring :D
Fun game but There‚Äôs nothing really new here. Pretty status quo and overdone storyline. Simple gameplay. Simple puzzles. Really not much of a challenge.
A truly top-notch game. It‚Äôs beautiful to look at, fun to play, and rewarding to explore.

My first impressions after playing for a couple hours on an iPad Pro, touch controls (no controller).

I think I would enjoy this game, but for the poorly placed controls and other movement problems.

I find myself constantly accidentally touching the aim toggle button and shooting/wasting ammo. Plus, while in aim mode I cannot move/dodge/melee attack, so I end up getting hit a couple times before I realize what happened. Please move the aim button up a bit, make it larger (so you can keep your finger on it and still move), and make it so that you have to keep your finger on the button to stay in aim mode. Release the button (or slide your finger off) and it exits aim mode.

I have found myself wanting to drop off a ledge or box, the drop down button appears, I click it and my character climbs back up. Really? Please fix.

The system used to control followers is clunky. I have to spend way too much time trying to get them to do what I want, making them totally frustrating to use. I hate that I am required to use them for some of the puzzles. Please fix the followers, or remove the requirement to use them in puzzles.

Please add the ability to zoom in and scroll around the map. Being able to place notes and markers on the map would be a welcome addition.

title.label: Fun but the controls aren‚Äôt great

content.label: I‚Äôm having trouble navigating because the features on the left are hard to use. I want to look around but end up throwing what I‚Äôm carrying or attacking. Or I‚Äôll get completely turned around and cant see something attacking me. Frustrating.

This the best game I ever played.It has great puzzles challenges and action but I one request for the developers who played a role in making this great game and that is that the  story and game keeps on going.

In the beginning of the game in oceanhorn2 the sound tracks is pretty good and it is a nice set to the seen when you start playing.
But I get that corn fox is a very small company, just to clarify. The sound track like at the middle of the game when the dark army is here is here the sound track is SAD üòê I mean it really doesn‚Äôt make any sense. And at the end of the game the music gets a little annoying and most of the music is not really advancer like except if you are is a village that‚Äôs fine. My point is music can give a game so much experience to a player and can really tell the story.

This is a Great Game by all means one of the best Apple Arcade games out now aside from sneaky sasquatch. Would Love if you could add more swords and caster guns with higher damage/special abilities/ or just customizable in the look department.
Would also love if you could add clothing items in the game, new hats, no hats, new shirt, shoes.
And lastly with the underwater helmet it would be better if it was like a mouth piece, that just activates when you enter water.
Will gladly still play the game all over again regardless if you add something I suggest or not, next updateüòáüíöüéÆ

Far and away the best RPG I‚Äôve played on mobile.  Thanks for doing it right.  Keep up the great work.

title.label: Worth playing but can use a little bit of work but worth the time

content.label: I normally don‚Äôt write that many reviews or any but this game is definitely one worth writing on. For one thing I definitely love this games layout and open world environment it gives room for grinding and high pay off exploration. While this isn‚Äôt all there is i also like it‚Äôs interface and console level smooth and optimized graphics great for running on iOS. The game is definitely one worth trying out and has a lot of great ways to grind and buildings you can enter as a sort of side quest to test your skill and improve your stats. While the game isn‚Äôt perfect i will definitely acknowledge that it‚Äôs a great title on Apple Arcade and with enough growth and improvements it can definitely make Apple Arcade get better titles. Even so i can‚Äôt totally give this a five star and it has problems. one thing touch control isn‚Äôt the best more often than not your character will freeze up or have trouble moving. Also there‚Äôs always the other bug where your comrades disappear and are not there in though battles. Finally I wish for there to be an update. where your comrades can differentiate bombs from enemies it truly is annoying. How on earth you keep getting killed because you just tried to get one thing and suddenly your killed cause the npcs can‚Äôt tell the difference. Overall while this is my general opinion of the game. Its definitely a good entry game of choice when you wish to kill time and I truly do enjoy it. However to anyone reading this It truly is one game you won‚Äôt regret playing. To the developers keep up the good work and please make improvements as you go on its definitely a game i would recommend to anyone and thank you for making an amazing game.

Fantastic game. It has the feeling of a Legend of Zelda style fantasy RPG but on my phone. The graphics are pretty and the gameplay so far has been fun. One of the games that has made Apple Arcade worth the price of subscription. I would recommend this game to my friends. Very entertaining.
Not well polished for a great ip. Maybe my expectation was too high.

title.label: I really wanted to give a 5 star but I can‚Äôt

content.label: I haven‚Äôt finished the game yet but overall I have enjoyed it and been really impressed by the graphics and size of the game. The inability to jump and dodge is extremely frustrating. The controls are impossible. I have spent hours trying to beat bosses because I‚Äôm unable to dodge 80% of the time that I click the button (that isn‚Äôt even a button it‚Äôs just an imaginary click site below the sword).. Beside that huge & bad thing, one boss fight can easily take 15 minutes, which is reallyjust  too long?? My hand gets sore trying to finish one boss fight and I‚Äôm 22 and have no carpal tunnel or anything so that means it‚Äôs too much. Also I don‚Äôt like that you can‚Äôt really do anything with the map. You can‚Äôt really visit past places easily, it‚Äôs extremely hard to land on an island that you approach .. idk. I feel like they made stuff way harder than it should be and that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm probably about to quit because I can‚Äôt beat mesmeroth and I have played several times. The game has SO much potential and is so great but these things really reALLLLLLYYYY frustrate me

title.label: Way too hard... No tip... no quest detail.. no online walkthrough.

content.label:
I‚Äôm not a puzzle game new bee. I‚Äôve beaten all series of Tomb Raider and Hitman Go. This game is ... hard to a broken level. 

After 1 hour gameplay, it seems that the main story hasn‚Äôt even started. No problem. It leads me to a forest tower, that‚Äôs where the nightmare truly starts. 

I was first stuck at the closed gate. I had similar experience playing Tomb Raider Anniversary, that is, a game feels hard once not familiar with its pattern. I patiently tried to find this pattern, but no luck. An online guide showed me the way. Ok, good. Go on. Soon enough, I‚Äôm trapped in another room, with no level, not even any interactive object. The companion is silent. Nothing gives any verbal nor visual tip. The online guide shows how to exit the tower, but it clearly is not about this puzzle. The quest description is non-exist. Nothing more than 1 line saying : Meet master Mayfair. It‚Äôs been an agonizing experience for me so far. 

It has good graphics, and very bad storyline that stops a player before he can get a hang of it. Also basically nothing getting you hooked in at least the first hour of gameplay. What‚Äôs worse, no tip at all while riddled with tons of clueless puzzles.
im playing an iPhone 7 and every time I die or  reach a new area and there is a cutscene, the game force closes. Can i get any assistance with this problem?

I CANT EVEN!! This game is SOOO scary! I am 10 and this is scary!!!!!!!!!! Also it is SOOO glitchy! I don‚Äôt like this game but I gave it a two star rating because I felt like I was being a little bit rude.

-lol love

Creators of Oceanhorn 2: Knights of the Lost Realm ( and others reading this review ),

The original Oceanhorn game was an instant classic in my eyes. (even if it was a game based off of another) It had not just held my attention but captured me and many others in a trances with its amazing design and its environmental and verbal storytelling. It was a shining light in the dim garbage dumb that was the Apple store. A main staple of that game which made it so great was that it wasn‚Äôt a purely RPG game. It also included exploration. If you wanted to just go through the main story with the only islands you had to, you could and if you wanted to explore every island the game had to offer, catch every fish, find every spell, every bloodstone, every ghosts skull, you could. The different places you could traverse, the dungeons you could conquer made it so enjoyable and made it fell so big like it actually was an archipelago. I fell like Oceanhorn 2 was smaller and you had less freedom and where you could go and not go was based on your current main story mission. 

Devs, I think you should still make more Oceanhorn games make your next game like your first.

title.label: Not an optimal game for iPhone11

content.label: iPhone 11 heats up and dims the screen after 15 minutes of gameplay. Around 30 minutes is when the screen really dims to a point that I can‚Äôt see.

I love this game but it keeps crashing on my mac in the same spot on the map and it won't stop, i've tried deleting & downloading it again as well as starting a new game, it's very frustrating because I really want to play it!

title.label: A good game that revolutionizes Mobile Adventure

content.label:
I first played this game about 6 months ago when Apple was promoting the subscription when Apple Arcade got kinda popular. Honestly, I was pretty impressed by the visuals of the trailer and the graphics seemed amazing for a mobile adventure game. It‚Äôs probably inspired by TLoZ, but you can‚Äôt really compare an iOS mobile game to a console video game‚Äî different consoles, graphics, technology, etc. For being one of the first mobile adventure games with a decent storyline, controls, smooth graphics, and nice music... this game revolutionized how mobile gaming could potentially aspire to be on the level of console video games. Now, there are more games like Beyond a Steel Sky that have so much potential and room for growth to expand the genre of mobile adventure games. 

Is Oceanhorn the greatest game ever? Probably not, but I can‚Äôt discredit that I did enjoy the game and I want play more. The downfalls of the game were the repetitive-stale missions and the lackluster ending, but going through this game a second time with the recent update has improved the gameplay significantly. I do appreciate the developers for reading reviews and improving the game. This is admirable and is the reason why I re-downloaded the game to see what was updated. Whether it‚Äôs a mobile or video game, what makes a game from being good to great is all about the developers‚Äî there is a lot of potential in Oceanhorn 2 and for future sequels. I look forwards to seeing more from Oceanhorn and the developers. If you‚Äôre thinking about playing this game, give it a shot and just have fun.
This game is soooo good I play so much! I love this game. Great job! I love this game because it is like a puzzle üß© so good!

title.label: So much potential for the best game on the App Store

content.label: It has so many issues though, no jump button, no customizable UI, can‚Äôt move buttons around so I‚Äôm constantly tapping or doing something other than I want to do, I always press the aim button since it‚Äôs in the worst spot. The combat is pretty sub par, no lock on which should be a must on a mobile combat game, no roll button, no auto camera, you always have to manually turn the camera so if there‚Äôs enemies behind you or if you hit them off screen, you can no longer see them.
But why can we keep it!! It really reminds me of a game in a PSP. Make this free for everyone.

Oceanhorn 2 is a great game! I‚Äôm hooked, haha. I only rated it 4 stars though because I wish that there were an actual ‚Äújump‚Äù button. It‚Äôs quite frustrating when I want him to jump somewhere but he won‚Äôt, lol. Other than that, it‚Äôs a visually stunning game and it‚Äôs a lot of fun. üëçüèΩ

I have no idea how to walk around in the game.  The controls.  Where the f are they and how do I use them.  

So far Arcade is so not worth the money.

This is maybe the best mobile game ever created. The controls are fluid. It plays flawlessly to the point where you don‚Äôt need controls seriously if only more games could have more ingenuity like this

This was probably my favorite game I've ever played on mobile. It was amazing.... Until the underground pita electricity puzzle where you hit the three buttons. That is COMPLETELY game breaking. Absolutely destroys the game momentum. I ran out of electricity... And one of your idiot devs put a save spot on top... So I'm out of electric shots and it auto saved. I can't continue. I have to run around and scavenge power shots now? That's ridiculous. The puzzle doesn't even seem possible. I've seen youtube videos and I really feel you guys shortened the timer on this build because on my game, the shield drops way too quick. on the shield you're supposed to stand on. This needs to be fixed.

title.label: Incredible potential but gem play is clunky

content.label: Just started playing this game and overall really enjoying it! However, the actual gameplay and controls I found to be a little clunky. Because the control buttons that stay on the screen are so large I find myself accidentally activating controls while trying to move through the game. I also find that because there‚Äôs no way to recenter yourself (i.e how you can do so in BOTW for Link) it makes your battles more difficult as its easy to lose your opponent. I also wouldn‚Äôt hate a manual button for jumping instead of it being automatic, maybe like a double tap on the left side to jump like you do on the right to roll? I enjoy the concept and graphics of this game immensely however, and I feel with a few tweaks to the controls it could easily become one of my favorites.
Just played the game again. Lots of new content and bosses. Really liked the other changes, like marking the dagger locations on the map.
